From: Heggie David <HeggieD@scot-textiles.heriot-watt.ac.uk>
Subject: CRD:C'Mon Billy by PJ Harvey
Date: Tue, 28 Nov 95 14:15:00 PST


C'MON BILLY

by Polly Jean Harvey
Performed by PJ Harvey
from "To Bring You My Love" LP
Chords written out by David Heggie

Firstly, the song itself is fairly easy to play chord-wise -
there's no hard chords in it at all.  There's a fair amount of
muting of the strings, very like in her other song on the same
album, "Send His Love To Me". No amount of describing would tell
you how to play this - just listen to the record and play along -
 you'll get the hang of it.

The chords used & how to play them are :

     Am    C    Dm    Em e:---0-----0----1-----0-----  Notice how she plays the Am chord
B:---1-----1----3-----0-----  it's played this way (hammering on
G:---0h2---0----2-----0-----  the E and A notes) throughout the
D:---0h2---2----0-----2-----  verses.  Again, to make it
A:---0-----3----0-----2-----  clearer, listen to the record.
E:---0----(3)---x-----0-----

Here's how they fit into the Verse and Chorus :

[VERSE]

[ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
  C'mon Billy,     Come to me
[ch]Am[/ch]                    [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]   [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]
  You know I'm waiting,  I'll love you endlessly.
[ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]
  C'mon Billy,    you're the only one,
[ch]Am[/ch]                          [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]
  Don't you think it's time now you met your on-ly son ?
[ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]
  I remember      our lovers' play
[ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]Dm[/ch]  [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]
  The corn was golden,  we lay in it for days
[ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]   [ch]Am[/ch]                   [ch]C[/ch]
  I remember      the things you said
[ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]Dm[/ch] [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]Dm[/ch]
  My little Billy,    come to your lo-ver's bed

[CHORUS]
[ch]Dm[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]
  Come home,  is my plea
[ch]Em[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]
  Your home now is  here with me
[ch]Dm[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]
  Come home  to your son
[ch]Em[/ch]
  Tomorrow might never come

[VERSE]
C'mon Billy, you look good to me
How many nights now your child inside ohh - v.unsure about this!
Don't forget me, I had your son
Damn thing went crazy, but I swear you're the only one

[INSTRUMENTAL] for rest of verse

Then just repeat :

[ch]Am[/ch]                [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]
  Come along Billy,    Come to Me

Until the end of the song.
Easy-Peasy.
 ,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
| David Heggie, SCOT, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh |
| EMail: HeggieD@scot.hw.ac.uk OR texdh@bonaly.hw.ac.uk |

I figured these chords by ear and got the chord names from Guitar Pro, they may or may
not be accurate. The chords themselves may or may not be accurate. I got the lyrics from
another website, so they may or may not be accurate either, and I can't always tell what 
Davey is saying myself.

Here is how I play the chords According to the parts of the song and such, the only one
I'm not entirely fond of is the D11 over the "if it hurts you breathe in" because it
doesn't sound right to me, and after fiddling for a while I could find the appropriate 
chord that it sounds like they play there, so please leave a comment if you're aware of the
correct chord. I play the D11 that way and it doesn't sound too awful, though.

You could probably also just play the chords without the 7's and the add9 stuff and just
do regular majors and minors but I tried to make it sound as accurate to the song as I could.

Otherwise, thanks for checking it out, this is my first time figuring out chords by ear. :)

I have done this in standard tuning as it's played in power chords,(and because I'm lazy and hate
retuning my guitar).If you want to play it open,(it'll sound fine),tune your guitar UP a semi tone,
(mind that high E string),or capo the 1st fret then play D,G and A. Try playing around with the D# 
at the start of each verse. By sliding your finger from the D onto the D# as you play the chord you 
should be able to get that rock'n'roll sound. As always comments, corrections and critisism welcome.
